items.title: Total White Screen
items.body:
Hello,

After installing Jupyter-Theme with `pip install jupyterthemes`, and starting the kernel after the command `jt -t chesterish`. The _Home_ page at my `http://localhost:8888/tree` gets to the color of the theme, but nothing is printed, no menus, just a solid colored page, and I'm not able to interact with it anymore. 

I've tried:
1. Reset with `jt -r`, it gets the empty page white
1. Uninstall `jupyterthemes`, reinstall it, and remove it totally
2. Uninstall and reinstall `jupyter` & `notebook`, as well as the remaining folders manually
3. Clearing my browser cache, as well as privates windows, and different browsers
4. Uninstalling Python, and replace it in an other PATH

Nothing worked, the _Home_ page remains white after the full Python reinstall.

My configuration:
1. Windows 10
2. Python 3.7
3. All installs are made with pip 19

items.title: Installing corrupts kernel
items.body:
Hi, 

My specs are Ubuntu 18.04, Jupyter notebook & lab installed with pip3.
Unfortunately, since the simple command
```bash
pip3 install jupyterthemes
```
both jupyter notebook and lab cannot start a kernel. Even after uninstalling jupytertheme, reinstalling jupyter and its dependencies : https://github.com/jupyter/notebook/issues/1892#issuecomment-260403964 the problem is not fixed.

Jupyter version : 4.4.0
ipython version : 7.3.0

I am afraid that jupyterthem installation process is corrupting a pip notebook installation.

But the problem is, there is no startup.py file in the directory. 

How can I fix this?

items.title: grade3 markdown cells have no left border
items.body:
Hi,
Thanks for giving a breath of fresh air to Jupyter. I'm a sucker for simplicity and design.

A small issue. Usually, when you select a cell, you expect a **visual feedback**.
In Jupyter, a little left border (the leftmost one which is coloured when the cell is selected) does this job.
However, the latest version (0.18.2 at the time of this writing) has no such border for markdown cells.

In the images attached below, I've selected either of the two cells.
But, there's no indication when the markdown cell is selected.
![screenshot from 2017-10-31 20-26-56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22019235/32230932-48e0ccc4-be7a-11e7-8492-cb23c5b4bdf0.png)

items.title: Less-Tempfiles are within package dir
items.body:
The less Tempfiles are created as
```python
# path to save tempfile with style_less before reading/compiling
tempfile = os.path.join(package_dir, 'tempfile.less')
vimtemp = os.path.join(package_dir, 'vimtemp.less')
```
This is a problem on some linux distributions, as the package dir will be in `/usr/lib/` and thus write protected for ordinary users.

The quick fix `sudo jt [...]` doesn't work, as the themes will then be installed into the root user's home directory.

Is there any reason we're not using `tempfile.mkstemp` from the standard library?

items.title: Provide minimum versions for your requirements
items.body:
pip-installing jupyter-themes force-installs the latest release for packages like seaborn, which force-installs the latest version of numpy. 

For anaconda users, this can overwrite the mkl-optimized numpy package, and can lead to side-by-side versions of conda ipython and pip ipython.

This can be remedied by specifying minimum required versions for the packages.

```
import pandas as pd

from IPython.display import display

out = Output()
with out:

```

Bevan
